publications.name: Can comets deliver prebiotic molecules to rocky exoplanets?
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Royal Society of London Series A
publications.summary: The cometary delivery of prebiotic feedstock molecules requires impacts at very low velocity. In this work, we use both an analytical model and N-body simulations, to show that the lowest velocity impacts occur in tightly packed planetary systems around high-mass (i.e., Solar-mass) stars.

publications.name: The plausibility of origins scenarios requiring two impactors
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Royal Society of London Series A (in press)
publications.summary: One potential way to achieve the conditions required for several prebiotic chemical scenarios, is via the cometary delivery of hydrogen cyanide, followed by the collision of a secondary, smaller body. Here, we demonstrate, using constraints on Earth's early bombardment, that these scenarios are extremely unlikely after 4.0Gya.
